Add the quinoa, reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for 17 to 20 minutes, or until all of the liquid is absorbed. Cover and set aside to steam for 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/better-broccoli-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To roast the broccoli: Slice any large broccoli florets in half to make bite-sized pieces. Transfer the broccoli to your prepared baking sheet and toss with 2 tablespoons olive oil, until lightly coated on all sides. Sprinkle with salt and arrange in a single layer. Bake for about 20 minutes, until the broccoli is tender and starting to caramelize on the edges.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/better-broccoli-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the breadcrumbs: Tear your piece of bread into bite-sized pieces and toss them into a food processor or blender. Process until the bread has broken into small crumbs. In a small pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the garlic and cook just until fragrant, stirring often. Add the bread crumbs and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until slightly browned and crisp. Set aside to cool. (If you cooked your bread crumbs in a cast iron skillet, transfer them to a bowl to prevent them from burning.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/better-broccoli-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the oven heat to 350 degrees. Add the salt, pepper and red pepper flakes to the pot of quinoa, and stir to combine. Set aside &frac34; cup of the cheese for later, then add the rest of the cheese to the pot. Pour in the milk and stir until the cheese and milk are evenly incorporated in the quinoa.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/better-broccoli-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the cheesy quinoa into a 9-inch square baking dish and top with the roasted broccoli. Cover the pot and wait for the kernels to pop, which might take a few minutes. In the meantime, place a large serving bowl near the stove so it\u2019s ready when you need it.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/perfect-stovetop-popcorn-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the kernels pop, turn off the burner, remove the pot from the heat and pour in the remaining popcorn kernels. Cover the pot again, and give the pot a little shimmy to distribute the kernels evenly. Let the pot rest for 60 seconds to make sure the oil doesn\u2019t get too hot before the kernels are ready to pop.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/perfect-stovetop-popcorn-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the heat back up to medium, put the pot back onto the burner and continue cooking the popcorn, carefully shimmying the pot occasionally to cook the kernels evenly. Once the kernels start popping, tip the lid just a touch to allow steam to escape (see photo).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/perfect-stovetop-popcorn-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Continue cooking until the popping sound slows to about one pop per every few seconds. Amounts given below yield two cocktails.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Red Pepper Martini", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/10/red-pepper-martini-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/10/red-pepper-martini-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/10/red-pepper-martini-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/10/red-pepper-martini-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/red-pepper-martini/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 medium bell pepper, seeded and sliced into 2-inch pieces", "&frac14; medium jalape\u00f1o pepper, seeded (use more or less depending on how spicy you want the drink to be)", "1 lime, juiced", "&frac12; garlic clove, peeled", "3 ounces Stoli vodka", "1 teaspoon agave nectar or simple syrup", "1 dash hot sauce, preferably Cholula", "Freshly ground black pepper", "Coarse sea salt or kosher salt, optional"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, line the rims with black pepper and salt if desired. Transfer coconut flakes to a bowl to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/thai-curried-butternut-squash-soup/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the squash mixture is done cooking, taste and add a little more Thai red curry paste if it\u2019s not quite flavorful enough for you. Remove the soup from heat and let it cool slightly. Working in batches, transfer the contents to a blender (do not fill your blender past the maximum fill line and be careful with the hot soup!). Securely fasten the lid and use a kitchen towel to protect your hand from steam escaping from the top of the blender as you pur\u00e9e the mixture until smooth. Recipe yields about 4 bowls or 6 cups of soup.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Butternut squash soup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/roasted-butternut-squash-soup-recipe-0-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/roasted-butternut-squash-soup-recipe-0-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/roasted-butternut-squash-soup-recipe-0-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/roasted-butternut-squash-soup-recipe-0.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-soup/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 large butternut squash (about 3 pounds), halved vertically* and seeds removed", "1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more for drizzling", "&frac12; cup chopped shallot (about 1 large shallot bulb)", "1 teaspoon salt", "4 garlic cloves, pressed or minced", "1 teaspoon maple syrup", "&#8539; teaspoon ground nutmeg", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "3 to 4 cups (24 to 32 ounces) vegetable broth, as needed", "1 to 2 tablespoons butter, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit and line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Place the butternut squash on the pan and drizzle each half with just enough olive oil to lightly coat the squash on the inside (about &frac12; teaspoon each). Rub the oil over the inside of the squash and sprinkle it with salt and pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-soup/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the squash face down and roast until it is tender and completely cooked through, about 40 to 50 minutes (don&#8217;t worry if the skin or flesh browns\u2014that&#8217;s good for flavor). Set the squash aside until it\u2019s cool enough to handle, about 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-soup/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, in a large soup pot, warm 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat until shimmering (if your blender has a soup preset, use a medium skillet to minimize dishes.) Add the chopped shallot and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring often, until the shallot has softened and is starting to turn golden on the edges, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute, stirring frequently. Transfer the contents to your stand blender (see notes on how to use an immersion blender instead).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-soup/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a large spoon to scoop the butternut squash flesh into your blender. Discard the tough skin. Add the maple syrup, nutmeg and a few twists of freshly ground black pepper to the blender. Pour in 3 cups vegetable broth, being careful not to fill the container past the maximum fill line (you can work in batches if necessary, and stir in any remaining broth later).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-soup/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Securely fasten the lid. Blend on high (or select the soup preset, if available), being careful to avoid hot steam escaping from the lid. Stop once your soup is ultra creamy and warmed through.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-soup/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you would like to thin out your soup a bit more, stir in the remaining cup of broth. Add 1 to 2 tablespoons butter or olive oil, to taste, and blend well. If not, pour it back into your soup pot and warm the soup over medium heat, stirring often, until it&#8217;s nice and steamy. I like to top individual bowls with some extra black pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-soup/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT55M", "totalTime": "PT1H5M", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 bowls or 6 cups"], "recipeCategory": "Soup", "cookingMethod": "Roasted and blended", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "1495", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "155 calories", "sugarContent": "6.9 g", "sodiumContent": "1244.8 mg", "fatContent": "6.8 g", "saturatedFatContent": "2.4 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "24.3 g", "fiberContent": "3.7 g", "proteinContent": "2.7 g", "cholesterolContent": "7.6 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dRoasted", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;yTTZ8802&Prime;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;yTTZ8802&Prime;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Nancy Prescott"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-30", "reviewBody": "I just made this soup and it is so delicious! Recipe yields 4 bowls.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "vegetarian pinto posole", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/04/vegan-posole-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/04/vegan-posole-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/04/vegan-posole-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/04/vegan-posole-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pinto-posole-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 to 4 guajillo chili peppers*", "2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "1 large white onion, finely chopped", "4 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "1 tablespoon\u00a0ground cumin", "&frac12; cup\u00a0(4 ounces) tomato paste", "1 bay leaf", "3 cans (15 ounces each)\u00a0pinto beans, rinsed and drained", "1 can (15 ounces) hominy, rinsed and drained", "32 ounces (4 cups) vegetable broth", "2 cups water", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt, to taste", "&frac14; cup chopped cilantro, divided", "1 lime, halved", "Recommended garnishes: sliced avocado, shredded green cabbage, chopped radish, onion and/or jalape\u00f1o"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut off the stem ends of the chilis and shake/flick the chilis to remove as many seeds as possible (it\u2019s ok if some remain). Rinse them and pat them dry.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pinto-posole-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat an empty Dutch oven or soup pot over medium heat until a few drops of water evaporate quickly from the pan. Toast the chilis in the dry pan, pressing them flat with a spatula for a few seconds until fragrant, then flip them over and press them again for a few seconds. Remove the toasted chilis and set them aside for now.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pinto-posole-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the same pot (still over medium heat), warm the olive oil until shimmering. Add the onion and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring often, until the onions are tender and translucent, about 5 minutes.\nAdd the garlic and cumin and cook until fragrant while stirring, about 1 minute. Add the tomato paste and cook, while stirring, for 1 minute.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pinto-posole-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the toasted chili peppers, bay leaf, hominy, beans, vegetable broth and water to the pot. Stir in &frac12; teaspoon salt and raise the heat to medium-high. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer, stirring occasionally, and cook for 25 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pinto-posole-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the chili peppers and bay leaf from the soup and discard them. Stir the cilantro and juice of &frac12; lime into the soup. Taste, and add more salt (I usually add at least &frac14; teaspoon more) and/or lime juice if necessary. For extra richness, add a little splash of olive oil and stir it in.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pinto-posole-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the remaining lime into small wedges. I also made veggie stock from scratch, to use up things like onion trimmings, the tops of celery with leaves, etc., and added a diced red bell pepper to the onions. I used 6 guajillo chilis for a double batch. I chose to use equal quantities of hominy and beans. SUPER DELICIOUS! I added extra cilantro, finely sliced purple cabbage, thinly sliced radishes, and avocado to each bowl before serving, to get as many vegetables into the mix as possible. It makes sense to make a big batch to have extra for the freezer and refrigerator, because you'll definitely want to eat this again and again!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jan"}, "datePublished": "2023-08-13", "reviewBody": "I adore this recipe. I always stock up on hominy when I run across it in anticipation of the next time I'm craving this posole!\r\n\r\nI love all of your recipes, but this one is in the hall of fame for me for sure :)"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jackie"}, "datePublished": "2023-09-26", "reviewBody": "This was amazingly good! I started out with four peppers because of a comment here saying that it wasn't spicy at all with two. However, just prepping the peppers gave me a coughing fit and irritated my sinuses. That's just from removing the seeds, rinsing them and toasting them (I wore plastic gloves, too). I put all four into the soup initially, but chickened out and pulled two out. If your peppers are spicy ones, then you only need two. I had fairly large peppers I bought via Amazon. Two was the PERFECT amount. If you don't like a lot of heat in your food, then stick with two peppers. It was nicely spicy. I used shredded cabbage, avocado, and some plant-based Mexican blend cheese for garnishes. It was a fabulous combination of textures and flavors. I used a pound of Rancho Gordo beans I wasn't sure what to do with. I think many different types of beans would work in this recipe! I looked for a posole recipe in the first place because I had a bag of Rancho Gordo Bean Club posole I wasn't sure what to do with. I may buy it intentionally in the future just to make this soup! It's much tastier than hominy. Works great in this soup. I used 1 3/4 cups of cooked posole."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Maddie"}, "datePublished": "2023-10-11", "reviewBody": "I\u2019ve been making this soup for a few years now and it\u2019s just so good. It\u2019s a fantastic vegetarian version. When I\u2019m in a hurry I use chili powder. But it\u2019s really next level when you follow Kate\u2019s suggestion to stew 2-4 guajillo peppers or New Mexico red chili pods in the recipe. I used 4 dried red chili pods from Alamosa, Colorado, picking out the seeds &amp; roasting them in the empty pot first, then adding them back in later. There\u2019s nothing like the northern New Mexican fragrance of red chili simmering and frothing with bay leaf, beans, hominy, cumin, onion, garlic and tomato paste. The tomato paste is not overwhelming at all and adds a brightness. The cilantro &amp; lime are perfect. The chili flavor was authentic and robust with a mild to medium spice level. The texture of the hominy soaks up the rich chili flavors. The posole just gets better over 1-2 days in the fridge. Thanks for a great recipe Kate!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sarah"}, "datePublished": "2024-12-27", "reviewBody": "This recipe is so delicious and comforting that it has made its way onto my family\u2019s regular dinner rotation. Leftovers will keep well in the refrigerator, covered, for up to 1 week. Hold each head of garlic from the base and carefully slice off about &frac14;-inch of the top to expose the garlic cloves. We want to be sure each clove is exposed. You may need to peel off some of the outer papery material to see better. If necessary, use a paring knife to cut off the tops of the cloves on the sides. Repeat for additional heads of garlic, if needed.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-roasted-garlic-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the garlic bulb(s) in an oven-safe stainless steel saucepan or skillet with an oven-safe lid*, with a base wide enough that the bulbs don&#8217;t touch the sides. Drizzle each bulb with 1 to 2 teaspoons of oil, enough to coat the exposed tops. You might need to use your fingers to rub oil that reaches the bottom of the pan back onto the tops.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-roasted-garlic-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover your pan and bake for 40 to 70 minutes, checking every 10 minutes after 40 minutes is up (be careful, the pot will be very hot!). The heads are done when they&#8217;re nicely golden on top and the cloves are soft enough to easily pierce through with a paring knife. (For greater depth of flavor, roast 5 to 10 minutes longer, but watch out for signs of burning\u2014an acrid smell, or blackened bits).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-roasted-garlic-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the roasted garlic cool for at least 10 minutes, or until you can safely handle it. I also spread some avo salsa verde (from your Spaghetti Squash Burrito bowl recipe) on the the tortillas.  The only thing I would change is next time I will use a separate pan to cook the eggs.  I'm all about 1 pan meals, but my eggs came out a weird greyish color from the spices.  Once wrapped, they can't be seen and it all tasted great!!  I will certainly make these again.  Added bonus that the same veggies are used in the SS burrito bowls - two meals from 1 list of ingredients...saves on food waste:-)"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Loaded Cafe"}, "datePublished": "2025-09-02", "reviewBody": "I absolutely love how versatile and flavorful these breakfast tacos are! The combination of scrambled eggs and saut\u00e9ed vegetables makes for a hearty and satisfying meal. It's great to see a recipe that encourages using leftover veggies, making it both practical and delicious. I often find myself searching for the healthiest breakfast near me and these tacos are a perfect homemade alternative that doesn't compromise on taste or nutrition."}], "datePublished": "2019-07-23", Thanks for the effort you put into this."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Pat"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-08", "reviewBody": "Oh Kate, I have to admit when this recipe first popped up in my email it took me back 50 years to the first and only time I made muesli.  I was a big fan of oatmeal, and an even bigger fan of hippie era granola, and muesli was touted as the super star of health food breakfasts at the time.  The first bite of pasty soggy raw oats made me swear off the stuff for half a century.  Your idea of toasting all that goodness, well that made it promising enough for me to give it a try.  And boy am I glad I did!  This will now become my go-to summer camping breakfast!  \r\n\r\nA couple of thoughts that others might be interested in:  (1) I could taste salt, and since I use salt to enhance flavors and generally not be a recognizable flavor by itself, I will halve the amount next time.  Obviously this suggestion is subject to individual tastes.  (2) If you like coconut, definitely seek out the large unsweetened flakes.  The grated form doesn't give enough oomph and it tends to sift to the bottom of the batch and burn.  (3) A tip from my gallon-jar granola making days:  bake this in 2 or 3 batches.  You only want a thin layer in your baking sheet at a time so it toasts evenly.  You can quickly develop a feel for when it is evenly toasted by how it feels when you stir it.  It should feel dry and not draggy on the pan when you stir it, but watch it like a hawk the last 2-3 minutes so it doesn't burn.  (4) Another tip from decades of eating oats - when you finish that half-cup serving you will immediately want to go back for more.  Don't!  Raw oats, even if you pour milk over them, will continue to absorb moisture and expand in size in your stomach.  Give it 20 minutes before deciding you really want another serving.\r\n\r\nThanks for another great Cookie &amp; Kate recipe!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "jennifer felix"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-16", "reviewBody": "Took the Muesli to our family reunion. Sprinkle with the red pepper flakes, if using, and several twists of pepper.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-feta-dip-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 20 minutes on the upper third, then place the dish on a heat-safe surface. Carefully, using a fork, find each of the four garlic cloves and smash each one against the side of the pan. Gently swirl the feta and tomatoes together\u2014not enough to make the dish completely uniform, but to more evenly distribute the ingredients. Taste, and add a pinch of salt if desired (the dish is usually plenty salty for me when made with olives, but without them you may prefer a bit of additional salt).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-feta-dip-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sprinkle all over with fresh basil. Bring the mixture to a simmer over high heat, then carefully pour the hot vinegar mixture into the jar. You should have enough to completely submerge the vegetables (and maybe a little extra). Tuck the bay leaf into the side of the jar.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spicy-quick-pickled-vegetables-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the pickles cool to room temperature (about 1 &frac12; hours) before gently tapping the jar to remove air bubbles. The pickles should be pretty well pickled and ready to consume at this point. I'm SO excited to try this on other veggies now. THANK YOU!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Catsy"}, "datePublished": "2020-06-12", "reviewBody": "This is actually a classic medley for this Mexican side dish! But I think people who only pickle one thing at a time are crazy, or not crazy enough ;) the more veggies you layer in, the cooler it looks, too! \r\n\r\nJust some ideas for fellow veggie adventurers: okra, radish, bell peppers, asparagus, green beans, daikon, cabbage, ginger, chiles, eggplant...\r\n\r\nI recommend making an afternoon out of it and maybe getting someone to do some slave labor -- err, help with chopping! Then you can make a bunch of jars at a time with different veg combos. I'd do some of these without the jalapenos and vary spices, maybe add mustard seed, dill, and/or coriander to some -- but that's me.\r\n\r\nYou can pay the help with a jar of delicious pickled veggies ;)"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sarah"}, "datePublished": "2017-07-17", "reviewBody": "Just did this. Recipe yields 4 modest servings (about 3/4 cup each), so I'd double it if you're feeding 3 or more people, or want leftover oats for later.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Savory oats", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/02/savory-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/02/savory-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/02/savory-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/02/savory-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/savory-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups water", "1 cup neutral-flavored milk of choice (like cow&#8217;s milk or plain, unsweetened almond milk) or an additional cup of water", "1 tablespoon unsalted butter or olive oil", "1 cup steel-cut oats (choose certified gluten-free oats if necessary)", "\u00bc teaspoon salt, more to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "Mix-in ideas: grated cheese or nutritional yeast, drizzle of additional olive oil or pat of butter, saut\u00e9ed veggies or greens, sun-dried tomatoes, red pepper flakes and/or ground spices", "Topping ideas: toasted chopped nuts or seeds, fried/poached/scrambled eggs and/or lightly dressed fresh greens"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large saucepan, combine the water and milk. Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat. In the meantime, melt the butter or warm the olive oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Once the butter is sizzling or the oil is shimmering, add the oats and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden and fragrant, around 2 minutes. This toasting step greatly enhances the flavor of the oats.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/savory-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir the oats into the simmering water/milk mixture. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer gently for about 20 to 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is very thick.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/savory-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the salt. Continue to simmer the mixture, stirring occasionally and reducing heat as necessary to prevent scorching on the bottom, until almost all of the liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes. (If you have doubled the recipe, your oatmeal might need an extra 5 minutes cooking time here.) The oatmeal will be very creamy when it&#8217;s done.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/savory-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from heat and let the oatmeal rest for 5 minutes before serving so it has more time to thicken up and cool down a palatable temperature. Season to taste with additional salt (I added another &frac14; teaspoon), pepper and optional spices. Recipe yields 6 bowls or 8 cups of soup.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "minestrone soup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/01/vegetarian-minestrone-soup-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/01/vegetarian-minestrone-soup-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/01/vegetarian-minestrone-soup-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/01/vegetarian-minestrone-soup-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/classic-minestrone-soup-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "1 medium yellow onion, chopped", "2 medium carrots, peeled and chopped", "2 medium ribs celery, chopped", "&frac14; cup tomato paste", "2 cups chopped seasonal vegetables (potatoes, yellow squash, zucchini, butternut squash, green beans or peas all work)", "4 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "\u00bd teaspoon dried oregano", "\u00bd teaspoon dried thyme", "1 large can (28 ounces) diced tomatoes, with their liquid (or 2 small 15-ounce cans)", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth", "2 cups water", "1 teaspoon fine sea salt", "2 bay leaves", "Pinch of red pepper flakes", "Freshly ground black pepper", "1 cup whole grain orecchiette, elbow or small shell pasta", "1 can (15 ounces) Great Northern beans or cannellini beans, rinsed and drained, or 1 &frac12; cups cooked beans", "2 cups baby spinach, chopped kale or chopped collard greens", "2 teaspoons lemon juice", "Freshly grated Parmesan cheese, for garnishing (optional)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Warm 3 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or stockpot over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the chopped onion, carrot, celery, tomato paste and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring often, until the vegetables have softened and the onions are turning translucent, about 7 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/classic-minestrone-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the seasonal vegetables, garlic, oregano and thyme. Cook until fragrant while stirring frequently, about 2 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/classic-minestrone-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour in the diced tomatoes and their juices, broth and water. Season generously with freshly ground black pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/classic-minestrone-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Raise heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a boil, then partially cover the pot with the lid, leaving about a 1\u201d gap for steam to escape. Reduce heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/classic-minestrone-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook for 15 minutes, then remove the lid and add the pasta, beans and greens. Continue simmering, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until the the pasta is cooked al dente and the greens are tender.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/classic-minestrone-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from the heat, then remove the bay leaves. Stir in the lemon juice and remaining tablespoon of olive oil. Taste and season with more salt (I usually add about &frac14; teaspoon more) and pepper until the flavors really sing. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking sheet and bake until golden, gently stirring the granola halfway, about 15 to 17 minutes. Chop the kale leaves into small, bite-sized pieces. Transfer the chopped kale to a big salad bowl. Sprinkle a small pinch of sea salt over the kale and massage the leaves with your hands by lightly scrunching big handfuls at a time, until the leaves are darker in color and fragrant.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kale-apple-salad-with-granola-croutons/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the salad, drizzle all of the dressing over the kale and toss well. If you are NOT using arrowroot starch, remove the pot from heat. If you ARE using arrowroot starch, transfer a few tablespoons of the ice cream mixture to a small bowl. Add the arrowroot starch to the bowl and whisk to get out all of the lumps. Pour the mixture into the pot and gently simmer for 1 minute, whisking frequently. Remove the pot from heat.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/peanut-butter-honey-ice-cream/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the mixture to a heat-safe mixing bowl to aid the cooling process. I designed this sauce to be quite thick; if you&#8217;d prefer a thinner sauce, drizzle in a bit more olive oil while running the machine.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cilantro-hemp-pesto-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use immediately or store in an air-tight jar in the refrigerator for up to 5 days (I believe it would freeze well for up to 3 months, but I haven&#8217;t tried). Recipe yields 8 cr\u00eapes.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "sweet cr\u00eapes, savory cr\u00eapes, buckwheat cr\u00eapes, classic", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/05/crepes-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/05/crepes-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/05/crepes-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/05/crepes-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crepes-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["&frac34; cup all-purpose, whole wheat or buckwheat flour\u00a0", "2 teaspoons sugar (up to 1 \u00bd tablespoons for sweeter crepes)", "Optional: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract (for sweet crepes)", "\u00bc teaspoon salt", "\u00be cup milk of choice", "2 large eggs", "1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted (plus more butter for greasing the pan)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a blender, food processor or big bowl, combine all of the ingredients. Blend, process or whisk by hand until the mixture is completely smooth, pausing to scrape down the sides at least once. Once you are certain that there are no big lumps of flour, set the bowl aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crepes-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat a medium-sized skillet, either stainless steel or non-stick, over medium heat. Once the pan is hot, add a small pat of butter. Use a clean rag or paper towel to quickly spread the butter into an even, very light layer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crepes-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a \u00bc cup measuring cup to ladle batter into the pan. Tilt the pan to about 45 degrees toward you as you pour in the batter, then immediately swirl the batter around in so it evenly covers the entire surface of the base.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crepes-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook the crepe until the top surface has turned from shiny to matte and the bottom is speckled with brown spots, less than 1 minute. Loosen the edges and flip the crepe to cook on the other side (I used a large silicone spatula for this step). Once the crepe is lightly speckled on the other side, slide it onto a plate.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crepes-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Repeat until you have no more batter, adding a small pat of butter and wiping the skillet between each one. To serve, top one crepe at a time as desired, and either roll it up or fold it into quarters. Enjoy! Leftover crepes will keep well for up to 4 days in the refrigerator, stacked and covered (add toppings just before serving). My favorite enchilada recipe! Recipe yields 8 enchiladas, enough for about 4 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "vegetarian black bean enchiladas", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/04/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/04/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/04/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/04/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups homemade enchilada sauce", "2 tablespoons olive oil", "1 cup chopped red onion (about 1 small red onion)", "1 red bell pepper, chopped", "1 bunch of broccoli or 1 small head of cauliflower (about 1 pound), florets removed and sliced into small, bite-sized pieces", "1 teaspoon ground cumin", "&frac14; teaspoon ground cinnamon", "5 to 6 ounces baby spinach (about 5 cups, packed)", "1 can (15 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed, or 1 &frac12; cups cooked black beans", "1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided", "&frac12; teaspoon fine salt, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "8 whole wheat tortillas (about 8 inches in diameter)", "Handful of chopped cilantro, for garnishing"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit with one rack in the middle of the oven and one in the upper third. Lightly grease a 9 by 13-inch pan with olive oil or cooking spray.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the olive oil until simmering. Add the onions and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring often, until the onions are tender and translucent, about 5 to 7 minutes. Add the broccoli and bell pepper, stir, and reduce heat to medium-low. Cover the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 8 to 9 minutes, or until the broccoli is brighter green and just starting to turn golden on the edges.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the cumin and cinnamon to the skillet and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the spinach, a few handfuls at a time, stirring until it has reduced in size. Repeat with the remaining spinach and cook until all of the spinach has wilted.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the contents of the pan to a medium mixing bowl. Add the drained beans, &frac14; cup cheese and a drizzle of enchilada sauce (about 2 tablespoons). Season with &frac12; teaspoon salt and some freshly ground black pepper, to taste.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Assemble the enchiladas: Pour &frac14; cup enchilada sauce into your prepared pan and tilt it from side to side until the bottom of the pan is evenly coated. To assemble your first enchilada, spread \u00bd cup filling mixture down the middle of a tortilla, then snugly wrap the left side over and then the right, to make a wrap. Place it seam-side down against the edge of your pan. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drizzle the remaining enchilada sauce evenly over the enchiladas, leaving the tips of the enchiladas bare. Sprinkle the remaining shredded cheese evenly over the enchiladas.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake, uncovered, on the middle rack for 20 minutes. If the cheese on top isn&#8217;t golden enough for your liking, carefully transfer the enchiladas to the upper rack of the oven and bake for an additional 3 to 6 minutes, until sufficiently golden and bubbly.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-enchiladas-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from oven and let the enchiladas rest for 10 minutes (they\u2019re super hot!). Before serving, sprinkle chopped cilantro down the center of the enchiladas. Serve immediately. Tossed with olive oil and sea salt, sweet potato fries are an easy and healthy homemade snack or side dish. Recipe yields 4 side servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Baked sweet potato fries", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2010/12/crispy-baked-sweet-potato-fries-with-ketchup-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2010/12/crispy-baked-sweet-potato-fries-with-ketchup-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2010/12/crispy-baked-sweet-potato-fries-with-ketchup-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2010/12/crispy-baked-sweet-potato-fries-with-ketchup-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 pounds sweet potatoes (about 2 medium-large or 3 medium)", "1 tablespoon cornstarch", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt", "2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "Optional spices: freshly ground black pepper, cayenne pepper and/or garlic powder"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit with racks in the lower and upper thirds of the oven (make sure the top rack is about 6&#8243; from the heat source and no closer). Line two large, rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper so the fries don&#8217;t get stuck to the pans.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Peel the sweet potatoes and cut them into fry-shaped pieces about &frac14;&#8243; wide and &frac14;&#8243; thick. Try to cut them into similarly sized pieces so the fries will bake evenly. Transfer half of the uncooked fries to one baking sheet, and the other half to the other baking sheet.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sprinkle the sweet potato fries with the cornstarch (use 1 &frac12; teaspoons per pan) and salt (&frac14; teaspoon per pan). Toss until the fries are lightly coated in powder. Drizzle the olive oil over the fries (1 tablespoon per pan) and toss until the fries are lightly and evenly coated in oil, and no powdery spots remain (use your fingers to rub visible cornstarch into the fries as necessary).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange your fries in a single layer and don&#8217;t overcrowd; otherwise they will never crisp up.\u00a0Bake for 20 minutes, then flip the fries so they can cook on all sides. (The easiest way to flip them is with a metal spatula. Section by section, scoop up about ten fries and flip them with a quick turn of the wrist.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange the fries in even layers across the pans again, moving any particularly browned fries more toward the middle of the pan so they don&#8217;t get overcooked. Return the pans to the oven, swapping their positions (former top pan goes to the lower rack and vice versa).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 10 to 18 more minutes, or until the fries are crispy. You\u2019ll know they\u2019re almost done when the surface of the fries change from shiny orange to a more matte, puffed up texture. Keep an eye on them, as they can turn from crisp to burnt quickly. Sometimes the lower pan will be done a few minutes before the top pan. Don&#8217;t worry if the edges are a little bit brown; they will taste more caramelized than burnt.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If desired, toss the baked fries with seasonings, to taste. I like to use lots of freshly ground black pepper, and a scant &frac14; teaspoon each cayenne pepper and garlic powder. Serve warm!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-sweet-potato-fries/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT35M", "totalTime": "PT45M", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Side dish", "cookingMethod": "Baked", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "378", "ratingValue": "4.1"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "263 calories", "sugarContent": "9.5 g", "sodiumContent": "389.9 mg", "fatContent": "7.1 g", "saturatedFatContent": "1 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "47.4 g", "fiberContent": "6.8 g", "proteinContent": "3.6 g", "cholesterolContent": "0 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dSweet", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;dQmJfcta&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;dQmJfcta&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Connie"}, "datePublished": "2025-08-25", "reviewBody": "Been trying to make crispy sweet potato fries off and on for years, and this came the closest. I wondered if cutting them 1/4\" was too small. Rather than puff up, they shrink very small (as always). I had one potato (for 2 people), 11+oz, so did the arithmetic and adjusted the measures. For the first part, I took out 3+ min. early (saw some blackening). Flipped, moved to different racks, then set the timer for 10 min. Had about 6-7 min. left, but they looked and smelled done (with more blackening on edges). Would like them crisper yet, but these were very good. For sweet potato fries, I always make a dipping sauce (so good!) \r\nPer person in separate little dishes: a little plain Greek yogurt (maybe 2 tsp), then add in just a little maple syrup (to taste). I have a tiny whisk to mix it up. I never want any other dip with my sweet potato fries! Next time, I'll try to cut them just a tad bigger, and they'll probably cook longer. "Person", "@id": "https://cookieandkate.com/#/schema/person/c609c24a34a1976d0a3c1a1b0cd7f46a", "name": "Kathryne Taylor", "image": {"@type": "ImageObject", "inLanguage": "en-US", "@id": I've been sharing recipes here on Cookie and Kate since 2010, and I'm always cooking something new in my Kansas City kitchen. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Butternut Squash Frittata with Fried Sage", "description": "Simple, savory frittata made with butternut squash, onion, Parmesan and fried sage. This delicious gluten-free, meatless recipe is perfect for brunch or dinner. Recipe yields one 10-inch frittata, which is enough for 8 modest or 6 large slices of frittata.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "butternut squash frittata", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/12/butternut-frittata-with-fried-sage-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/12/butternut-frittata-with-fried-sage-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/12/butternut-frittata-with-fried-sage-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/12/butternut-frittata-with-fried-sage.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-frittata-with-fried-sage/", "recipeIngredient": ["8 large eggs", "&frac12; cup milk", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac34; teaspoon fine salt, divided", "1 cup freshly grated Parmesan or Pecorino Romano cheese, divided", "1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil", "&frac34; to 1 pound butternut squash (about 1 small or half of a medium butternut), peeled and chopped into &#8531;-inch cubes", "&frac34; cup chopped yellow onion", "Freshly ground black pepper", "1 to 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "16 fresh sage leaves (roughly &frac14; cup), chopped"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, garlic, &frac14; teaspoon of the salt, and several twists of freshly ground black pepper. Then whisk in about half of the cheese.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-frittata-with-fried-sage/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a 10-inch, well-seasoned cast iron skillet or oven-safe saut\u00e9 pan, warm 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and stir to coat. Cook for a few minutes, until the onions are starting to turn translucent. Add the squash and the remaining &frac12; teaspoon salt and stir. Cover the pan and reduce heat slightly to avoid burning the contents. Cook until the butternut is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-frittata-with-fried-sage/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Uncover the pan, raise the heat back to medium and cook until the excess moisture has evaporated and the butternut squash is starting to turn golden on the edges, about 5 to 10 minutes (add another little splash of olive oil if the squash starts sticking to the pan).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-frittata-with-fried-sage/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the heat down to low. Arrange the butternut in an even layer in the bottom of the skillet. Whisk the egg mixture one last time and pour it into the pan. Sprinkle the frittata with the remaining cheese. Once the outside edge of the frittata turns lighter in color (about 30 seconds to 1 minute), carefully transfer the frittata to the oven. Bake for 8 to 15 minutes (keep an eye on it), until the eggs are puffed and appear cooked, and the center of the frittata jiggles just a bit when you give it a gentle shimmy.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-frittata-with-fried-sage/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the frittata is baking, fry the sage: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the sage and toss to coat. Let the sage get crispy (but not brown) before transferring it to a plate covered with a paper towel. Sprinkle the fried sage lightly with salt and set it aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-frittata-with-fried-sage/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the frittata is done, sprinkle fried sage on top and let the frittata rest for a few minutes before slicing it into 6 large or 8 smaller wedges. Serve! Leftover frittata keeps well in a storage container for up to 5 days in the refrigerator. Whisk to blend.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-almond-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Crack the eggs into a medium bowl and beat with a whisk until the yolks and egg whites have blended together. Add the maple syrup, olive oil, and lemon zest and whisk to blend. Pour the wet ingredients into the almond meal mixture and stir until there are just a few clumps remaining.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-almond-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scrape the batter into the prepared pan (it will be runny; don&#8217;t worry). Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the cake is golden brown and the center is firm to the touch.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-almond-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, to make the glaze: In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon maple syrup until blended. (If you\u2019re using honey instead and having a hard time blending it into the lemon juice, place the bowl on top of your stove to warm it up while the cake bakes, or warm it briefly in the microwave until you can whisk them together.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-almond-cake-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the cake is out of the oven, place the cake, pan and all, on a cooling rack. Recipe yields two to four servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/02/sun-dried-tomato-caesar-salad-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/02/sun-dried-tomato-caesar-salad-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/02/sun-dried-tomato-caesar-salad-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/02/sun-dried-tomato-caesar-salad-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sun-dried-tomato-caesar-salad/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons olive oil", "&frac12; cup grated Parmesan", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "2 cups of &frac34;-inch cubes of rustic bread (I used whole grain sourdough)", "&frac14; cup roughly chopped sun-dried tomatoes", "&frac12; cup grated Parmesan", "2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice", "2 tablespoons water", "1 garlic clove, roughly chopped", "Pinch sea salt", "&frac12; cup extra-virgin olive oil", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "2 or more small heads of romaine (you can eyeball it), halved or chopped", "Sprinkle of additional Parmesan", "Sprinkle of additional chopped sun-dried tomatoes"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, a note on sun-dried tomatoes. I&#8217;m partial to Trader Joe&#8217;s sun-dried tomatoes that come in a bag because they aren&#8217;t oily but they&#8217;re soft enough to eat right out of the bag. You could also use oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, rinsed and patted dry. If you&#8217;re using tough, dried tomatoes, you&#8217;ll need to soak them in boiling water until they&#8217;re pliable, then pat them dry and continue with the recipe.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sun-dried-tomato-caesar-salad/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the croutons, preheat the oven to 400 degrees with a rack in the top of the oven. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Mix the olive oil, Parmesan and salt in a large mixing bowl until a paste is formed. Add the cubed bread and mix well with a spatula, until all the bread is coated. Turn the bread onto the prepared baking sheet and arrange in a single layer. I couldn&#8217;t quite mix in all of my Parmesan mixture, so I sort of lumped the excess on top of the bread pieces. Bake for 10 minutes, then stir and put the croutons back into the oven until they are golden brown and crisp, up to 5 more minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sun-dried-tomato-caesar-salad/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the dressing, combine the sun-dried tomatoes, Parmesan, lemon juice, water, garlic and a pinch of salt in a food processor or high-powered blender. Process for 1 minute, stopping to scrape down the sides if necessary. While running the machine, drizzle in the olive oil and blend for 10 more seconds. Don&#8217;t worry if it&#8217;s not perfectly smooth; it will still taste delicious! Taste and add more salt and some black pepper, if desired. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sun-dried-tomato-caesar-salad/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the salad, drizzle the dressing over your halved romaine or toss with your chopped romaine. Recipe yields 4 generous side servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/03/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa-6-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/03/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa-6-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/03/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa-6-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/03/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa-6.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa/", "recipeIngredient": ["16 ounces Baby Bella mushrooms", "1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil", "&frac14; teaspoon fine salt", "1 cup quinoa, rinsed in a fine-mesh colander", "2 cups water", "&frac12; cup Parmesan cheese, grated", "&frac14; cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, divided", "&frac14; cup thinly sliced green onions, green parts only", "1 clove garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling on top", "2 to 3 teaspoons lemon juice, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "2 tablespoons toasted pepitas"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the mushrooms: Preheat the oven to 425\u00b0F. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup (the rim is important, as the mushrooms release a lot of juices while roasting\u2014use a large baking dish if you don&#8217;t have a rimmed baking sheet).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Quarter the large mushrooms, halve the medium mushrooms, leave small mushrooms whole, and place them all onto the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle the olive oil over them and sprinkle the salt on top. Toss until the mushrooms are evenly coated in oil. Roast until the mushrooms are tender and somewhat condensed in size, about 15 to 18 minutes, tossing halfway.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, to cook the quinoa: Combine the rinsed quinoa and water in a saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then decrease the heat a bit to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook until the quinoa has absorbed all of the water, about 15 to 20 minutes. Reduce heat as time goes on to maintain a gentle simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from heat, cover, and let the quinoa steam for 5 minutes. Then, remove the lid and fluff the quinoa with a fork. Add the Parmesan, most of the parsley (reserve about 1 tablespoon for garnish), green onions, garlic, salt and olive oil. Stir to combine, then add 2 to 3 teaspoons lemon juice to the mixture and black pepper, both to taste.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble, pour the quinoa into a small serving platter or medium serving bowl. Top with the roasted mushrooms and their extra juices, then sprinkle pepitas and the remaining parsley on top. Finally, finish the dish with a light drizzle of olive oil over the mushrooms. This dish is best when fresh, but leftovers keep well in the refrigerator, covered, for up to 3 days.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-mushrooms-with-herbed-quinoa/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT40M", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Side", "cookingMethod": "Cooked and baked", "recipeCuisine": "American", "suitableForDiet": "GlutenFreeDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "42", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "308 calories", "sugarContent": "2.5 g", "sodiumContent": "532.1 mg", "fatContent": "13.9 g", "saturatedFatContent": "3.4 g", "transFatContent": "0.1 g", "carbohydrateContent": "35.1 g", "fiberContent": "4.8 g", "proteinContent": "13.7 g", "cholesterolContent": "10.8 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dHow", "description": "\u201dLearn", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;nlxwUNmt&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;nlxwUNmt&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Yvonne McDonald"}, "datePublished": "2019-05-25", "reviewBody": "I really enjoyed this and made it exactly as directed, except I didn\u2019t have fresh parsley so I used dried, and I used garlic powder because I was not convinced that I could thoroughly mix in one clove of minced fresh garlic in the almost finished quinoa. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Southwestern Corn Chowder", "description": "Make this Southwestern corn chowder for a cozy dinner at home! This vegetarian corn chowder recipe is fresh, wholesome and delicious. Recipe yields 8 cups or 4 generous bowls.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "corn chowder", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/10/southwestern-corn-chowder-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/10/southwestern-corn-chowder-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/10/southwestern-corn-chowder-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/10/southwestern-corn-chowder-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-corn-chowder-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil", "8 ears of fresh sweet corn, shucked (or 6 cups frozen corn kernels)", "1 pound red potatoes, cut into &frac34;\u201d cubes (about 3 cups)", "1 large red onion, chopped", "1 poblano pepper (optional)*, seeds and ribs removed, chopped\u00a0", "1 red bell pepper, chopped", "2 celery ribs, chopped", "&frac34; teaspoon salt, divided, to taste", "&frac12; teaspoon chili powder", "2 medium cloves garlic, pressed or minced\u00a0", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth", "2 cups water", "1 bay leaf", "2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into 4 pieces", "&frac14; cup chopped cilantro", "&frac14; cup cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche or sour cream or Greek yogurt**", "1 tablespoon fresh lime juice\u00a0", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "Suggested garnishes: Grated sharp cheddar cheese, thinly sliced green onion, additional cilantro leaves and/or a tiny pinch of chili powder"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium/large Dutch oven or soup pot, warm the olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add the corn, potatoes, onion, poblano, bell pepper, celery, \u00bd teaspoon of the salt, and \u00bd teaspoon chili powder. Stir to combine. Cook until the onions are tender and translucent, about 7 to 10 minutes, stirring every couple of minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-corn-chowder-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds to 1 minute, while stirring constantly. Add the broth and water and stir to combine. Drop in the bay leaf.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-corn-chowder-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Simmer for 20 to 25 minutes, stirring occasionally. It&#8217;s not done until the potatoes are fully cooked through and very easily pierced through with a fork.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-corn-chowder-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from the heat. Using kitchen tongs, remove the bay leaf. Carefully transfer about 3 cups of the soup (about half liquid, half solids) to a blender. Securely fasten the lid and be careful to avoid the hot steam as you blend until completely smooth. Add the butter and blend again.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-corn-chowder-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the mixture back into the pot. Add the cilantro, cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche (see note if using sour cream or Greek yogurt) and lime juice. Stir to combine. Season with the remaining &frac14; teaspoon salt and be generous with the black pepper, to taste. If you&#8217;d like more spice, add up to &frac12; teaspoon more chili powder, to taste.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-corn-chowder-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the chowder into bowls and top with garnishes of your choice. Leftover chowder will keep well in the refrigerator, covered, for up to 5 days or for several months frozen.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-corn-chowder-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT50M", "recipeYield": ["8", "8 cups"], "recipeCategory": "Soup or stew", "cookingMethod": "Stovetop", "recipeCuisine": "American", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "192", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 of 4 large bowls, no garnishes", "calories": "513 calories", "sugarContent": "26 g", "sodiumContent": "1051.6 mg", "fatContent": "19.1 g", "saturatedFatContent": "8.6 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "83.9 g", "fiberContent": "10.1 g", "proteinContent": "13.4 g", "cholesterolContent": "35.3 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dSouthwestern", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;zJpRgcNG&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;zJpRgcNG&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lara"}, "datePublished": "2024-03-04", "reviewBody": "I loved this recipe! This Bloody Mary mix is made from scratch with basic ingredients. It's perfect for your next brunch. Recipe yields 4 cocktails.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Bloody Mary, tomato cocktail", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/05/best-bloody-mary-mix-recipe-6-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/05/best-bloody-mary-mix-recipe-6-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/05/best-bloody-mary-mix-recipe-6-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/05/best-bloody-mary-mix-recipe-6.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/homemade-bloody-mary-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["32 ounces (4 cups) tomato juice", "8 ounces (1 cup) vodka", "1 medium-to-large cucumber, peeled and seeded", "&#8531; cup distilled vinegar", "1 teaspoon celery seed (not celery salt!)", "1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce*", "&frac12; teaspoon hot sauce (I used Tapat\u00edo), more to taste", "1 teaspoon (about 50 twists) freshly ground black pepper", "2 medium cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac14; teaspoon salt, optional", "Lemon or lime wedges", "Kosher salt, for the rims of your glasses, optional (add chili powder if you&#8217;d like)", "Lots of ice, for serving", "Garnishes (choose any):\u00a0Celery stalks,\u00a0skinny carrots with leafy tops, mini bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, dill pickle spears, pickled okra, and/or green cocktail olives"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a blender, combine the tomato juice, vodka, cucumber, vinegar, celery seed, Worcestershire sauce and hot sauce. Securely fasten the lid and blend on high speed until completely smooth.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/homemade-bloody-mary-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Taste, and add more hot sauce for more heat (it&#8217;s going to taste quite intense now, since the mix hasn&#8217;t cooled over ice yet). Add the black pepper and garlic. Securely fasten the lid and blend for just a few seconds (or longer, for a completely smooth texture). Taste, and stir in &frac14; teaspoon salt for more overall flavor if you&#8217;d like (tomato juice brands vary by salt content, so this is really up to you). Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/homemade-bloody-mary-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you&#8217;d like to rim your glasses with salt, run a lemon or lime wedge around the outside rim. Pour kosher salt onto a small plate (mix in chili powder if you&#8217;d like), and roll the wet edge of the glass across the salt at a 45-degree angle. Repeat with the remaining glasses.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/homemade-bloody-mary-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill the glasses with ice, and pour the Bloody Mary mix on top. Recipe yields about 6 side servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "caponata, Sicilian eggplant dish", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/09/sicilian-caponata-recipe-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/09/sicilian-caponata-recipe-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/09/sicilian-caponata-recipe-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/09/sicilian-caponata-recipe-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/caponata-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 large or 2 smallish eggplants (about 1 &frac34; pounds), cut into 1-inch cubes", "\u00bd teaspoon fine salt, divided, to taste", "4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "1 medium yellow onion, chopped\u00a0", "1 red bell pepper, chopped", "2 celery stalks, thinly sliced", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "1 can (14 ounces) crushed fire-roasted tomatoes", "\u00bc cup pitted green olives (ideally Castelvetrano), roughly chopped", "\u00bc cup raisins, red or golden", "3 tablespoons red wine vinegar or white wine vinegar, to taste", "2 tablespoons capers, drained", "1 tablespoon honey or sugar, to taste", "\u00bc teaspoon red pepper flakes, to taste", "1 bay leaf", "\u00bc cup chopped fresh mint, flat-leaf parsley and/or basil", "Homemade Crostini, optional, for serving"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper to prevent the eggplant from sticking to it.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/caponata-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cubed eggplant on the prepared pan. Sprinkle it with \u00bc teaspoon of the salt, drizzle with 3 tablespoons olive oil, and promptly toss to coat (some of the eggplant pieces will be more saturated with oil than the others, and that\u2019s ok). Roast the eggplant in the oven for 30 to 35 minutes, stirring halfway, until deeply golden.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/caponata-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the meantime, warm the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a medium Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, bell pepper and celery. Season with the remaining \u00bc teaspoon salt and about 10 twists of black pepper. Cook until the onions are tender and just starting to turn golden, about 9 to 12 minutes, stirring often.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/caponata-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes and stir to combine. Add the olives, raisins, vinegar, capers, honey, red pepper flakes, and bay leaf. Stir to combine. Simmer on medium-low heat for 10 minutes or so, stirring occasionally.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/caponata-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove and discard the bay leaf. Stir in the roasted eggplant and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in most of the fresh herbs, reserving a small handful for garnish. Remove the pot from the heat.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/caponata-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust to taste to find your desired balance of tangy-sweet-spicy-salty. Add more vinegar (by the tablespoon), honey (by the teaspoon), red pepper flakes (I like at least &frac14; teaspoon more, but I like spice), and/or salt (for more overall flavor). Transfer it to a serving bowl and top with the remaining herbs.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/caponata-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For best flavor, allow the caponata to rest at room temperature for an hour, or longer in the refrigerator. Recipe yields 8 appetizer servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Baked Spinach Artichoke Dip", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/09/spinach-artichoke-dip-with-tortilla-chips-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/09/spinach-artichoke-dip-with-tortilla-chips-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/09/spinach-artichoke-dip-with-tortilla-chips-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/09/spinach-artichoke-dip-with-tortilla-chips.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-spinach-artichoke-dip-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil", "1 small yellow onion, chopped", "1 red bell pepper, chopped", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "Pinch of salt", "10 ounces frozen chopped spinach), thawed*", "1 jar (12 ounces) marinated artichokes or 1 can (15 ounces) canned artichokes in water, drained and chopped", "8 ounces sour cream or Greek yogurt", "2 ounces crumbled feta or goat cheese (about &frac12; cup)", "6 ounces freshly grated part-skim mozzarella (about 1 &frac12; cups), divided", "3 dashes of your favorite hot sauce (I recommend Cholula)", "Freshly ground black pepper", "For serving: Tortilla chips, pita wedges, small slices of toasted bread, crackers, or crisp, firm veggies"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-spinach-artichoke-dip-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the\u00a0olive oil until shimmering. Add the onion, bell pepper, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion and bell pepper are nice and tender, about 5 to 7 minutes. Meanwhile, squeeze as much moisture out of the thawed spinach as possible.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-spinach-artichoke-dip-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the spinach and artichoke to the pan and cook for 1 minute, using your spatula to break up any hunks of spinach.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-spinach-artichoke-dip-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the skillet from the heat and add the sour cream, feta and two-thirds of the mozzarella (about 1 cup). Stir until the ingredients are all mixed together. Season to taste with additional salt, some black pepper, and a few dashes of hot sauce (more if you want more of a kick).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-spinach-artichoke-dip-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the mixture to a small casserole dish\u00a0(about 1-quart capacity) and spread it evenly into the pan. Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella over the contents. Recipe yields 4 generous side servings; you can double the recipe by cooking it in a large Dutch oven.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "green beans almondine", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/11/best-green-beans-recipe-2-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/11/best-green-beans-recipe-2-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/11/best-green-beans-recipe-2-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/11/best-green-beans-recipe-2-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-green-beans-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons unsalted butter, sliced into several pieces", "&frac12; cup sliced almonds", "&frac14; cup thinly sliced shallot (about 1 small)\u00a0", "1 pound haricots verts or slender green beans, trimmed", "2 teaspoons lemon juice, to taste", "1 tablespoon + \u00bd cup water, divided\u00a0", "\u00bd teaspoon fine salt, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet over medium-low heat, melt the butter. Once it\u2019s completely melted, add the almonds. (Your patience will pay off, I promise!)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-green-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the shallot and cook, while stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Stir in the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon water. While stirring, cook until the liquid thickens enough that your spatula leaves an open trail on the pan behind it, about 1 more minute.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-green-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use your spatula to scoop all the mixture into a bowl, and set it aside for now. Return the empty skillet to the stovetop, and add the green beans, \u00bd cup water and \u00bd teaspoon salt. Cover and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the beans are nearly tender, about 9 to 10 minutes.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-green-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the lid and cook over medium-high heat until the liquid evaporates, about 2 to 4 minutes.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-green-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Off the heat, add the reserved almond mixture to the skillet and toss to combine. Great, a classic. \r\n\r\nYour tequila rec's could use some work. For starters neither reposado nor anejo should taste smokey. While Anejo should be left out, Reposado can make a superior Paloma, since the pepper and mineral notes of a good blanco tequila will be distracting. \r\n\r\nWhich brings us to our second point. You recommend three additive laden brands of Blanco (Casamigos is being sued currently for being so full of junk it's false advertising) and then say this; \"They\u2019re my top brands for all tequila cocktails. Always choose 100 percent agave tequila so you know exactly what you\u2019re buying. Cheaper tequila mixtos contain a blend of alcohols and additives that can contribute to hangovers.\" 100% agave does not mean your tequila does not have additives and coloring and flavor in it, and mixto's are not a blend of additives and alcohols. A mixto is tequila and sugarcane juice. It's one thing to give a recipe, it's another to just toss out misinformation."}], "datePublished": "2024-04-18", "@id": "https://cookieandkate.com/paloma-cocktail/#recipe", "isPartOf": {"@id":
