Recipe yields 4 large portions or 6 to 8 side salads.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Brussels sprout salad, holiday salad", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/brussels-sprout-arugula-salad-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/brussels-sprout-arugula-salad-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/brussels-sprout-arugula-salad-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/brussels-sprout-arugula-salad-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/shredded-brussels-sprouts-arugula-salad-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 pound Brussels sprouts", "5 to 6 ounces baby arugula", "1 &frac14; cups pecan halves or pieces", "&frac12; cup dried cherries or cranberries, chopped", "4 ounces goat cheese, crumbled", "&#8532; batch sunshine salad dressing"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the Brussels sprouts, first cut off the nubby ends and discard any discolored outer leaves. Then, carefully shred the sprouts with a sharp knife by hand, then roughly chop them for good measure. Or shred them in your food processor using the slicing disk. Place the arugula and shredded Brussels in a large serving bowl, and set it aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/shredded-brussels-sprouts-arugula-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toast the pecans in a large skillet over medium heat, stirring often, until they\u2019re fragrant and starting to toast on the edges, about 4 to 6 minutes. Then, reserve 3 large carrots and set them aside. Slice the remaining carrots on the diagonal into pieces about &frac12;&#8243; thick and 1 &frac12;&#8243; long. On the baking sheet, toss the carrot pieces with enough olive oil to lightly coat them. Arrange them in a single layer and sprinkle them lightly with salt. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, tossing halfway, until the carrots are tender and turning deeply golden on the edges.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-raw-carrot-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, slice the remaining 3 carrots into very thin rounds (about as thin as you possibly can; you should have about 1+ cup sliced). Place the carrot rounds in a bowl, and fill the rest of the bowl with cold water and a handful of ice cubes (this will make the carrots nice and crisp). Set the bowl aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-raw-carrot-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the carrots are done roasting, arrange them across a large platter. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat while whisking often. While the mixture warms up, whisk the arrowroot starch with a couple tablespoons of the coconut milk mixture in a small bowl until thoroughly incorporated and no lumps remain.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chai-affogato-with-honey-sweetened-coconut-milk-ice-cream/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the coconut milk mixture reaches a gentle simmer, pour the arrowroot mixture into the pot and simmer, whisking constantly, for one minute. Remove from heat, let cool to room temperature, then place the bowl in the refrigerator until the mixture is completely and thoroughly chilled.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chai-affogato-with-honey-sweetened-coconut-milk-ice-cream/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before you start your ice cream maker, place your future ice cream container in the freezer to chill. Use a spoon to scoop off the thickened top layer of ice cream and discard it. Whisk together the chilled mixture in case the honey has separated from the rest. Pour the mixture into your ice cream maker and freeze according to your manufacturer\u2019s instructions, then transfer it to your chilled container. Freeze for several hours.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chai-affogato-with-honey-sweetened-coconut-milk-ice-cream/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When you&#8217;re ready for dessert, bring 2 cups water to a boil and pour the water over 8 chai tea bags. Steep for 4 minutes, then remove the bags (squeeze out some of the water they have absorbed). Scoop your ice cream into small bowls, then pour hot tea into the bowls. Chop the green onions (about 1 cup) and cut the tomatoes into quarters, adding both to the bowl as you work. Seed and chop the red bell pepper and add it to the bowl. Toss the vegetables to coat well in the dressing.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/wild-rice-kale-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the cooking cycle is complete, let the pressure naturally release for 10 minutes, then move the steam release valve to Venting to release any remaining pressure. This healthy, comforting soup recipe is perfect for chilly days. Recipe yields 4 bowls of soup.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Thai curried cauliflower soup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/12/curried-cauliflower-soup-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/12/curried-cauliflower-soup-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/12/curried-cauliflower-soup-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/12/curried-cauliflower-soup-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/curried-cauliflower-soup/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 medium-to-large head of cauliflower (2 to 3 pounds), broken into small florets", "Up to 4 tablespoons melted coconut oil or olive oil, divided", "1 medium yellow onion, chopped", "1 to 3 tablespoons Thai red curry paste* (depending on the brand and your preferred spice level)", "&frac12; teaspoon lemon zest", "Optional: &frac12; cup unoaked white wine (like Sauvignon Blanc or Pinot Grigio)**", "2 cups vegetable broth", "1 can (14 ounces) light coconut milk", "1 to 3 teaspoons rice vinegar, to taste", "Salt and freshly ground black pepper", "Optional garnishes: &frac14; cup chopped green onions or chives, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil (preferably Thai), or red pepper flakes"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Toss the cauliflower with enough oil to lightly coat it (up to 3 tablespoons). Spread the cauliflower in a single layer on a large baking sheet and roast until the tips of the cauliflower are golden brown, about 25 to 35 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/curried-cauliflower-soup/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wait until the cauliflower is done before starting the soup (this is a good time to prep the remaining ingredients). In a Dutch oven or large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat, warm 1 tablespoon of the oil until shimmering. Add the onion and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is turning translucent, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the curry paste and lemon zest and stir to incorporate. If you&#8217;re using the wine, raise the heat to medium-high, pour it in, and cook, stirring frequently, until most of the wine has evaporated.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/curried-cauliflower-soup/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add half of the cauliflower florets and all of the stems to the pot. Add the vegetable broth and coconut milk. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer, stirring occasionally. Continue simmering for 5 to 10 more minutes to meld the flavors, reducing the heat to maintain a gentle simmer. Remove the pot from the heat.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/curried-cauliflower-soup/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the soup cool for a few minutes. For the creamiest results, transfer the soup in small batches to a blender, blending until each batch is smooth. (Don&#8217;t fill your blender past the maximum fill line; beware of the steam escaping from the lid.) Or, use an immersion blender and blend well.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/curried-cauliflower-soup/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in 1 teaspoon vinegar and season with salt and pepper, to taste. If the soup needs more acidity, stir in 1 to 2 additional teaspoons of vinegar (it will taste fantastic once you&#8217;ve added enough). Ladle the soup into 4 bowls. Top each with &frac14; of the cauliflower florets and a sprinkle of green onions, basil, and pepper flakes (if using). Leftovers will keep well in the refrigerator for 4 days or in the freezer for up to 3 months.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/curried-cauliflower-soup/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 bowls"], "recipeCategory": "Soup", "cookingMethod": "Roasted and stovetop", "recipeCuisine": "Thai", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "143", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 bowl", "calories": "250 calories", "sugarContent": "6.7 g", "sodiumContent": "539.8 mg", "fatContent": "19.8 g", "saturatedFatContent": "16.6 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "16.2 g", "fiberContent": "4.8 g", "proteinContent": "5.6 g", "cholesterolContent": "0 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "2"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer"}, "datePublished": "2022-05-03", "reviewBody": "Turned out way too spicy and had to dilute it with another can of coconut milk which made it bearable to eat, but still wasn\u2019t that tasty."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "kimberly"}, "datePublished": "2022-11-21", "reviewBody": "Hi hi! Two tips for those who are having difficulty getting the graininess out of the sugar with less powerful equipment. \r\n\u2022 Don\u2019t try to do too much at one time. My 40 year old cheap plastic Waring blender worked well, but I started with only 1/3 cup cane sugar. Multiple small batches is quicker than trying to do one big batch. \r\n\u2022 PULSE the sugar. It makes the sugar rise and fall around the blades and gives a more consistent result. I even picked up the blender and shook it a couple times to mix the sugar inside. These toasts make a great appetizer or meal. You could also turn these toasts into a sandwich if you prefer. If you're in a hurry, feel free to use store-bought hummus (roasted garlic would be awesome) and toast your bread in the toaster. Hummus recipe yields about 2 cups hummus. Double the amount of broccoli if you're feeding a crowd.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/05/sun-dried-tomato-hummus-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/05/sun-dried-tomato-hummus-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/05/sun-dried-tomato-hummus-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/05/sun-dried-tomato-hummus.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-broccoli-crostini-with-sun-dried-tomato-hummus/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 large bunch broccoli, sliced into bite-sized florets", "2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste", "1 loaf of crusty whole grain bread, sliced", "Olive oil, for brushing", "Lemon wedges and red pepper flakes, for garnish", "&frac14; cup tahini", "&frac14; cup fresh lemon juice (about 1 large lemon, juiced)", "2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for serving", "&frac34; cup drained oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes (I used one 6.7-ounce jar, drained)", "1 large garlic clove, roughly chopped", "&frac12; teaspoon salt, more to taste", "&#8539; teaspoon red pepper flakes", "One (15-ounce) can of chickpeas, also called garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed", "2 to 3 tablespoons water, optional"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To roast the broccoli: Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit with a rack in the middle of the oven and another rack in the upper third. On a large, rimmed baking sheet, toss broccoli florets with 2 tablespoons olive oil and a sprinkling of salt and pepper. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes on the middle rack, tossing halfway, until the edges are turning golden and crispy.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-broccoli-crostini-with-sun-dried-tomato-hummus/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To toast the bread: Brush both sides of your sliced bread lightly with olive oil and place them on a separate baking sheet. Bake for 6 to 10 minutes on the top rack (larger slices will require more baking time), turning halfway, until lightly golden and toasted. Remove from oven and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-broccoli-crostini-with-sun-dried-tomato-hummus/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the hummus: First, you&#8217;ll whip the tahini and lemon juice together to make them ultra smooth and creamy. Combine the tahini and lemon juice in the bowl of your food processor (a smaller food processor will be better suited to the job) or high-powered blender (i.e. Vitamix or Blendtec). Process for about 1 &frac12; minutes, pausing to scrape down the bowl of your processor as necessary.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-broccoli-crostini-with-sun-dried-tomato-hummus/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the olive oil, sun-dried tomatoes, chopped garlic, salt and red pepper flakes to the whipped tahini and lemon juice mixture. Process for about 1 minute, pausing to scrape down the bowl as necessary.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-broccoli-crostini-with-sun-dried-tomato-hummus/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add half of the chickpeas to the food processor and process for 1 minute. Scrape down the bowl, then add the remaining chickpeas and process for until the hummus is thick and quite smooth, about 1 to 2 minutes more. If your hummus is too thick or hasn&#8217;t yet blended into creamy oblivion, run the food processor while drizzling in 2 to 3 tablespoons water, until it reaches your desired consistency.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-broccoli-crostini-with-sun-dried-tomato-hummus/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble your crostini: Top each piece of toast with a generous spread of hummus. Using the small holes on a box/hand grater, or a rasp grater, or a food chopper makes the tzatziki really unpleasantly gritty. (I've tried.  Several times.) \r\nI found using both dill and mint together better than either one alone.\r\nWhen tweaking at the end, I've found adding a *little* extra salt to help. Before you get started, make sure that all of your ingredients are prepped and within an arm&#8217;s reach from the stove. Also have an empty bowl nearby for holding the cooked eggs and veggies. I&#8217;m suggesting that you start over medium-high heat, but if at any point you catch a whiff of oil or food burning, reduce the heat to medium.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-fried-rice-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Warm\u00a0a large cast iron or stainless steel skillet over medium-high heat until a few drops of water evaporate within a couple of seconds. Immediately add 1 &frac12; teaspoons of oil and swirl the pan to coat the bottom. Add the scrambled eggs and swirl the pan so they cover the bottom. Cook until they are just lightly set, flipping or stirring along the way. Transfer the eggs to a bowl and wipe out the pan with a heat-proof spatula.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-fried-rice-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Return the pan to heat and add 1 tablespoon of oil. In the meantime, use the edge of your spatula or a spoon to break up the scrambled eggs into smaller pieces.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-fried-rice-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a big spatula or spoon to transfer the contents of the pan to the bowl with the cooked eggs. Return the pan to heat and the remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add the ginger, garlic and red pepper flakes, and cook until fragrant while stirring constantly, about 30 seconds. Add the rice and mix it all together. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice is hot and starting to turn golden on the edges, about 3 to 5 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-fried-rice-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the greens (if using) and green onions, and stir to combine. This would be a great vegan potluck dish, but note that it is best when served promptly, as the salt will draw out the water from the cucumbers and dilute the flavors. Recipe yields 6 side servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/06/sesame-ginger-cucumber-soba-noodles-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/06/sesame-ginger-cucumber-soba-noodles-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/06/sesame-ginger-cucumber-soba-noodles-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/06/sesame-ginger-cucumber-soba-noodles-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sesame-ginger-and-cucumber-soba-noodles/", "recipeIngredient": ["8 ounces soba noodles (about 2 bundles) or spaghetti noodles of choice", "1 large or 2 small English cucumbers", "1 small-to-medium red bell pepper, chopped small (optional)", "1 bunch scallions (green onions), chopped (about &frac34; cup chopped)", "&#8531; cup tahini", "2 tablespoons rice vinegar", "1 tablespoon finely grated fresh ginger", "2 teaspoons reduced-sodium tamari or soy sauce", "1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil", "Handful of fresh cilantro, chopped, plus extra leaves for garnishing", "Pinch of red pepper flakes (optional, for heat)", "&#8531; to &frac12; cup water", "2 tablespoons sesame seeds (white or black)", "Salt, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook the soba noodles until al dente, according to package directions (do not overcook them!). Drain and rinse under cold water, then set them aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sesame-ginger-and-cucumber-soba-noodles/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a vegetable peeler, or better yet, a julienne peeler, to slice the cucumber into long, skinny strips. Discard the super seedy interior strips.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sesame-ginger-and-cucumber-soba-noodles/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, whisk together the tahini, rice vinegar, ginger, tamari, sesame oil, cilantro and red pepper flakes (if using). Once blended, whisk in water until you reach your desired consistency.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sesame-ginger-and-cucumber-soba-noodles/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toss the soba noodles in the sesame-ginger sauce (depending on how saucy you like your noodles, you may have some sauce left over). Toss in the cucumber strips, scallions, sesame seeds and extra cilantro if desired. Season to taste with salt or additional tamari until the flavors really sing. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro if you&#8217;d like. Chilaquiles are a classic Mexican dish of tortilla chips soaked in flavorful sauce\u2014in this case, red sauce. This recipe comes together quickly and is best served hot, so be sure to have every ingredient ready before you start cooking. Recipe yields 4 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "red chilaquiles, saucy tortilla chips", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons flour (whole wheat, all-purpose, or gluten-free blend all work)", "1 tablespoon ground chili powder", "1 teaspoon ground cumin", "\u00bd teaspoon garlic powder", "\u00bc teaspoon dried oregano", "\u00bc teaspoon salt, to taste", "Pinch of cinnamon", "3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "2 tablespoons tomato paste", "2 cups vegetable broth", "2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, plus additional for garnish", "1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar or distilled white vinegar", "5 big handfuls (5 ounces) corn tortilla chips, or homemade crispy baked tortilla chips (see post)", "\u2153 cup\u00a0crumbled Cotija, queso fresco or feta cheese", "1 small handful (about 3 tablespoons) very thinly sliced radish, or chopped red or green onion", "1 ripe avocado, thinly sliced, or guacamole", "Optional: 4 fried eggs or scrambled eggs or poached eggs", "1 small lime, cut into wedges"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the sauce: Measure the flour, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, salt and cinnamon into a small bowl. Place the bowl near the stove with the tomato paste and broth.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the oil until it\u2019s it\u2019s hot enough that a light sprinkle of the flour/spice mixture sizzles on contact. This might take a couple of minutes. Keep an eye on it.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once it\u2019s ready, pour in the flour and spice mixture. While whisking constantly, cook until fragrant and slightly deepened in color, about 1 minute. Whisk the tomato paste into the mixture, then slowly pour in the broth while whisking constantly to remove any lumps.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Raise heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook, whisking often, for about 5 to 7 minutes, until the sauce has thickened a bit and your spoon encounters some resistance as you stir it.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the heat to the lowest possible setting. Whisk in the cilantro and vinegar and season to taste with additional salt, if necessary (I usually add another pinch or two).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the chilaquiles: Add the tortilla chips to the skillet. Using a flexible spatula, gently toss until all of the chips are coated in sauce. It might seem like they never will be, but keep stirring!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once coated, remove the skillet from the heat. Test a chip to see if it has softened to your liking (this is really a matter of personal preference\u2014I like my chips lightly tender). If the chips are not sufficiently softened, cover the skillet for 1 to 4 minutes, until you&#8217;re happy with their texture.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-red-chilaquiles-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sprinkle the chilaquiles generously with crumbled cheese, radish and cilantro leaves. Scoop servings onto individual plates, add a few slices of avocado, a fried egg if desired, and a wedge of lime. Sprinkle it lightly with salt and massage it with your hands by scrunching up large handfuls at a time until it&#8217;s darker and more fragrant (this makes the kale more tasty and easier to eat). Add the chickpeas, olives and/or pepper rings, sun-dried tomatoes, and Parmesan (if using). Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/greek-kale-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To toast the sunflower seeds, combine the seeds with the olive oil and a few dashes of salt in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook, stirring often, until the seeds are fragrant and turning lightly golden at the edges, about 5 minutes. Pour the toasted seeds into the salad bowl.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/greek-kale-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the salad dressing: In a small liquid measuring cup or bowl, combine the tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, mustard, and salt. Whisk until blended. Add the water and whisk until blended. Season generously with freshly black pepper, to taste.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/greek-kale-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the dressing into the salad (you might not need quite all of it, but I did). Toss until the salad is evenly coated with dressing. Serve immediately. This refried bean recipe is quick, too\u2014use canned beans and they're ready in 25 minutes! Plus, these beans are healthy, vegan and gluten free. Recipe yields 2 1/2 cups refried beans (21 ounces), enough for 5 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "refried beans", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/04/quick-refried-beans-recipe-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/04/quick-refried-beans-recipe-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/04/quick-refried-beans-recipe-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/04/quick-refried-beans-recipe-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-refried-beans-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil", "&frac12; cup finely chopped yellow or white onion (about &frac12; small onion)", "&frac14; teaspoon fine sea salt", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac12; teaspoon chili powder", "&frac14; teaspoon ground cumin", "2 cans (15 ounces each) pinto beans, rinsed and drained, or 3 cups cooked pinto beans", "&frac12; cup water", "2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro", "1 tablespoon lime juice (about &frac12; medium lime), to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium saucepan over medium heat, warm the olive oil until shimmering. Add the onions and salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions have softened and are turning translucent, about 5 to 8 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-refried-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic, chili powder and cumin. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour in the drained beans and water. Stir, cover and cook for 5 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-refried-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the heat to low and remove the lid. Use a potato masher or the back of a fork to mash up about at least half of the beans, until you reach your desired consistency. Recipe yields 8 servings (quite a lot!) and leftovers are great.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "pumpkin mac and cheese", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/10/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/10/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/10/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/10/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons unsalted butter", "1 \u00bd teaspoons pumpkin spice blend*", "1 \u00bd teaspoons garlic powder", "1 \u00bd teaspoons onion powder", "1 can (15 ounces) pumpkin pur\u00e9e (not pumpkin pie filling)", "1 pound short-cut pasta (pipe regate, macaroni noodles, casarecce, cavatelli, fusilli)\u00a0", "5 cups water", "1 teaspoon fine salt, to taste", "4 ounces cream cheese, cubed\u00a0", "8 ounces shredded sharp cheddar cheese", "\u00bd cup (2 ounces) finely grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for serving"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the pumpkin spice, garlic and onion powders and cook for 2 to 4 minutes, stirring often, until the butter is very fragrant and you see many little brown flecks in the pan. Stir in the pumpkin and let it cook for a minute, while stirring.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour in the pasta, water and salt. Cover the pot and bring it to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, remove the lid and set the timer for 8 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook, stirring often (more often as the time goes on), until the timer goes off. Turn down the heat as necessary to avoid scorching but maintain a steady simmer. When the time goes off, do not drain the water. Stir in the cream cheese. Continue simmering until the cream cheese has melted and the pasta is al dente (careful when you taste, it\u2019s quite hot), about 4 to 5 more minutes.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the heat to low. Add the cheddar and Parmesan, and stir until the mixture is melted and creamy. Remove the pot from the heat.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Season with salt, to taste (I usually add \u00bc teaspoon or more). Serve the pasta in bowls with extra Parmesan grated on top, if desired. Leftovers keep well, covered and refrigerated, for up to 5 days (or freezes relatively well for up to 3 months).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeYield": ["8", "8 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Pasta", "cookingMethod": "Stovetop", "recipeCuisine": "American", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "26", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 bowl", "calories": "450 calories", "sugarContent": "3.8 g", "sodiumContent": "661.3 mg", "fatContent": "20.2 g", "saturatedFatContent": "11.3 g", "transFatContent": "0.3 g", "carbohydrateContent": "49.7 g", "fiberContent": "3.3 g", "proteinContent": "17.5 g", "cholesterolContent": "56.1 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dPumpkin", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;rpZ4XZ4r&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;rpZ4XZ4r&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Christina"}, "datePublished": "2023-10-14", "reviewBody": "I was craving mac and cheese and let me tell you, this hit the spot!
